definition: more hands than needed (idiom); too many cooks spoil the broth
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]

sentences.english: Nowadays, had not been appointed a new manager, company is somewhat overstaffing.
sentences.chinese: 如今，没有任命新经理，公司里就有点儿人浮于事。

sentences.english: Overstaffing has become the obstacle for reforms.
sentences.chinese: 人浮于事已成为改革的绊脚石。

sentences.english: God, overstaffing, only apply to so many people a business.
sentences.chinese: 天呀，人浮于事，才应征一名业务就那么多人。

definition: a mountain of paperwork and a sea of meetings (idiom)
to slacken off in one's work/to go slow (as a form of strike)
to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
to pass the buck/to shirk responsibility
internal friction/internal dissipation of energy (in mechanics)/fig. waste or discord within an organization
mutually shirking responsibilities (idiom); each blaming the other/passing the buck to and fro/each trying to unload responsibilities onto the other
to damage the public interest for personal profit (idiom); personal profit at public expense/venal and selfish behavior
see 徇私舞弊[xun4 si1 wu3 bi4]
